top_categories.workout_context: 320 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
320 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Trans Iowa's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 320 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Trans Iowa's Iowa farmland, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 320 miles.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 9,000ft of climbing on Iowa rolling farmland gravel does to your power file on race day.
9,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Trans Iowa's Iowa rolling farmland gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
At Trans Iowa, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Trans Iowa, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
9,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Trans Iowa. Train it until it feels boring.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 320 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 320 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Trans Iowa requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on iowa rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: iowa farmland, rolling gravel, 300+ mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, HVLI Extended, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 320 miles of iowa rolling farmland gravel in Checkpoint, Iowa.
